channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: About 50 of the 107 submissions to the inquiry related to the mandatory wearing of bike helmets, with 76 per cent opposing the laws.
item.title: WA ‘nanny state’ report floats changes to bike helmet and vaping laws

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: major easing of COVID-19 restrictions from midnight and national cabinet meets

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: How much is the prime real estate underneath the East Perth power station worth? Next to nothing according to the state government.
item.title: East Perth power station valued at just $1 in government deal with Stokes and Forrest

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Scott Morrison foreshadows economic recession as worse than GFC as global COVID-19 deaths pass 300,000, Australian death toll stands at 98

item.description: Reports of cases have raised concerns that COVID-19 could pose a greater risk to children than had been understood.
item.title: Coronavirus-linked children's disease cases spike in Italy, France

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX set to open higher after rocky Wall Street day

item.description: The British government has 'opened the door' for the Premier League to return next month but has left it to the game itself to iron out the details.
item.title: Premier League gets green light to resume in June

item.description: The world needs rules and guidelines for the post-coronavirus workplace, and China is the first laboratory.
item.title: 'Life will not become like it was before': China is teaching the world back-to-work lessons

item.description: Australia are set to visit England in July for three one-dayers and two T20 internationals but that prospect now appears remote.
item.title: England cricket boss calls for unity as players return to training

item.description: US President Donald Trump says he "doesn't feel the same" about the trade deal with China as relations between the two economic superpowers continue to deteriorate in the wake of COVID-19.
item.title: 'We could cut off the whole relationship': Trump ramps up China trade tensions

item.description: The US will likely be first in line should Sanofi succeed in developing a vaccine because the country was the first to fund the French company's research, Hudson said.
item.title: French outrage after Sanofi CEO's suggests US could get vaccine first

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: The former vaccine chief said he believes hospital workers died because the Trump administration was too slow to compel American companies to manufacture masks.
item.title: 'Completely decimated': Sacked whistleblower recalls ominous email

item.description: Two in 10 working adults said that in the past 30 days, they ran out of food before they could earn enough money to buy more. One-quarter worried that would happen.
item.title: Fears of hunger rise amid pandemic, economic collapse in US: poll

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: The app is not being made compulsory and has been the subject of criticism on privacy grounds, similar to those made in Australia.
item.title: Travellers to the UK will be asked to download tracing app at the border

item.description: The uncertainty in global markets has been on display during Wall Street's Thursday session.
item.title: Wall Street has rollercoaster day as hope and scepticism collide

item.description: The head of the organisation charged with bringing a semblance of order to international trade relations resigned, adding another element of uncertainty to the global economy during COVID-19.
item.title: 'Serious blow': WTO chief quits suddenly, adding to global economic turmoil

item.description: Personal and political branding is achieved so effectively in Mrs. America through consistent and unspoken uniforms. Sound familiar?
item.title: Mrs America is the fashion history lesson we all need

item.description: The FBI served a search warrant for Senator Richard Burr's mobile phone as part of an ongoing insider-trading investigation tied to the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: US senator steps aside amid FBI probe into pandemic stock sales

item.description: "The people want to get on with their lives. The place is bustling!" Trump said following the Supreme Court ruling.
item.title: Trump applauds Wisconsin ruling striking down lockdown order

item.description: Nearly 3 million laid-off workers applied for US unemployment benefits last week as the viral outbreak led more companies to slash jobs.
item.title: Thirty six million have sought US unemployment aid since virus hit

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: Sydney’s roads will likely feel the brunt of the city returning to work in coming weeks as the government prepares strategies to maintain social distancing on the public transport network.
item.title: Limits on train commuters, more CBD parking and bike lanes as Sydney returns to work

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: As the SANZAAR nations try to map out Super Rugby in the post-COVID-19 world, a bold plan to include the best Japanese teams is on the table.
item.title: Top League meets Super Rugby: bold plan to keep Japan involved

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: The HSC written exams have been delayed for five days to give students more face-to-face time with their teachers, but results will arrive before Christmas
item.title: HSC exams to be delayed for five days, with results before Christmas

item.description: As COVID-19 restrictions are eased across the State, we revisit May 15, 1919, when Sydneysiders could take off their masks and enjoy a trip to the theatre again.
item.title: From the Archives, 1919: Influenza restrictions lifted in New South Wales

item.dc:creator: Adele Ferguson
item.description: ME Bank has a lot to answer for given the lack of dividends it has paid to shareholders, lack of transparency and poor treatment of customers.
item.title: ME Bank's gobsmacking botch was a systemic failure

item.description: It will be political suicide to start lecturing to Australians about "personal responsibility" as they try to recover from the economic disaster of the pandemic.
item.title: Fend for yourself, people: a tone-deaf government plays dangerous politics

item.description: What drives employees to want to walk while they work?
item.title: Would you use a treadmill desk?

item.dc:creator: Alistair Nicholas
item.description: Australia needs to find alternative export markets to China, but in the meantime we must be wise. We need China's business and we should join up to its Belt and Road Initiative.
item.title: Put down the megaphone or China might opt for other imports

item.description: Before the pandemic, inequality in our schools was common - and too often out of sight. COVID-19 only makes it harder for the children left behind.
item.title: What COVID-19 reveals about the school kids in our midst who've always done it tough

item.description: In a time of uncertainty, one thing is clear - there will be no ''business as usual'' after the pandemic.
item.title: Recovery a big chance to clear the air, permanently

item.dc:creator: Bob Carr
item.description: The month of April passed with few noticing the huge exit from carbon, writes Australia's former foreign affairs minister.
item.title: While the world looked the other way, corporate giants abandoned coal

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: Many tech companies will be forced to stand on their own two feet once JobKeeper ends, which could hurt without investment incentives experts warn.
item.title: More layoffs 'catastrophic': Calls for startup help after JobKeeper

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Friday, May 15

item.description: For many children, COVID-19 has exacerbated existing anxieties, or brought about new ones. But you have the tools to help them.
item.title: Is your child anxious? Here's how to help them

item.dc:creator: Garry Maddox
item.description: The Inner West's Darcy Byrne believes the number of people continuing to use the popular loop make it a danger point for a virus outbreak.
item.title: Mayor says 'just stay away' from the Bay Run as restrictions ease

item.description: Being the recipient of good hospital care first sparked Phillip Ebb's interest in becoming a paramedic.
item.title: Community-minded aspirations fulfilled on the road

item.dc:creator: Ellen Fitzgerald
item.description: Bomb caught in fish nets, Skylab pictures for Australia and winter air pollution in Sydney at hazardous levels.
item.title: In the Herald : May 15, 1973

item.description: Ten years ago, 16-year-old Jessica Watson sailed into Sydney Harbour after 210 days at sea to become the youngest person to ever sail solo around the globe.
item.title: From the Archives, 2010: Nation rides wave of inspiration

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: The coronavirus has had a big impact on the legal profession, making the competition harder for new graduates who want to get a start.
item.title: Don't over think it and follow your heart into a legal career

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Labor is still searching for the best ways to perform an essential task in this Parliament – applying scrutiny in the middle of a crisis.
item.title: As pandemic plays out, Labor struggles for traction

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: Malcolm Turnbull and his publisher Sandy Grant are continuing to investigate the mystery of who received a leaked version of his biography.
item.title: Turnbull’s sleuths unravel the links of Canberra cabals

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 15, 2020

item.dc:creator: Chloe Booker
item.description: Melbourne’s CBD, St Kilda and Footscray are among the most dangerous suburbs to ride in, according to cyclists.
item.title: Melbourne cyclists single out scariest suburbs for riding

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: The test kits have been found to be less accurate at diagnosing COVID-19 than claimed, after the federal government bought 500,000 of them.
item.title: Canberra spent $10 million on inaccurate antibody tests

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: The Victorian government will present figures to national cabinet on Friday showing the scale of the mental health crisis facing the state.
item.title: Alarm raised over pandemic-linked mental health crisis

item.description: The tide is about to surge again and it will be a king tide that builds over the coming months and years.
item.title: Act now to stave off a mental health pandemic

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: The federal government has provided a three-step roadmap to start carefully relaxing limits on our movement. Here's how each state is easing its coronavirus restrictions.
item.title: COVID-19: What are the public health rules now?

item.description: A sessions court judge on Thursday ruled the charges against Riza Aziz would be withdrawn without acquittal after prosecutors said they had reached a deal in which the government would receive 'a substantial sum'.
item.title: Wolf of Wall Street producer in deal on money laundering case

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news
